resources.string: Espresso poured on a vanilla ice cream. Served in a cappuccino cup.

Espresso with added hot water (100-150 ml). Often served in a cappuccino cup. (The espresso is added into the hot water rather than all the water being flowed through the coffee that would lead to over extraction).
A tall, mild \'milk coffee\' (about 150-300 ml). An espresso with steamed milk and only a little milk foam poured over it. Serve in a latte glass or a coffee cup. Flavored syrup can be added.
A goated combination of coffee, milk, and palm sugar.
The perfect blend of coffee with the strong vanilla taste to lighten up your mood on the rough day..
I guess you like latte.. with less foam.
For those milk and chocolate combination lovers out there.
Brrrr, it a coarsely grounded coffee steeped in cold water for up to 24 hours, 12 minimal.
It\'s just a combination of milk, espresso, and condensed milk. No turning you into a hispanic.
A latte with sea salt and a topping of sea salt macchiato cream.
For those matcha lovers out there, YES, espresso with a high quality matcha powder.
A lovely combination of espresso, palm sugar, fresh milk, and pandan syrup. FLAVOR BOMB.
Let me guess.. matcha latte.. but with OATSIDE!
